_purpose: AI behavior guidelines - how AI should work on this project

items.title: Component Structure
items.description: Each component has a single [name].scss file with: reset styles and base styles using design tokens directly. Use layer-first tokens from tokens.scss - no component-specific variables. All styling controlled via token references (--control-border, --layout-background, etc.).

items.title: Web Components
items.description: Web components use Lit. They enhance native elements, not replace them. CSS works without JS, components add interactivity.

items.title: Layer-First Token Naming
items.description: Use layer-first naming for all tokens: --shell-gap, --layout-padding, --component-border, --control-height. Each layer (shell, layout, component, control) has its own independent set of tokens. Never use property-first names like --gap-shell or semantic names like --button-bg.

items.title: Prefer grid over flex
items.description: Always prefer CSS Grid over Flexbox for layouts. Grid is more powerful and predictable for 2D layouts.

items.title: No margin on elements
items.description: Never add margin to component elements. Use gap on parent containers (grid/flex) for spacing instead.

items.title: Workspace Structure
items.description: Project has two packages: lib/ (design system - CSS tokens, components, web components) and frontend/ (Svelte 5 docs app). Frontend imports lib via relative paths (../../lib/dist/). Icons are copied to frontend/public/icons/ for Vite serving.

items.title: Frontend Development
items.description: Run 'npm run dev' in frontend/ folder. Uses Vite + Svelte 5 with runes. Import lib CSS via @import '../../lib/dist/core.css' and JS via import '../../lib/dist/core.js'. Configure nuke-icon basePath to '/icons'.

items.title: Token Overrides
items.description: Frontend can override lib tokens in style.css. Override tokens at :root for global changes, or on any container for scoped changes. Both dark-theme and light-theme classes supported.

items.title: Token Usage by Layer
items.description: Use tokens matching folder level: 1-shell uses --shell-* tokens, 2-layout uses --layout-* tokens, 3-component uses --component-* tokens, 4-control uses --control-* tokens. Each layer is independent - no cascade between layers.

items.title: No Hardcoded Borders
items.description: Never use 'border: 1px solid var(--border-color-1)' directly. Always use layer token references: --layout-border for 2-layout, --component-border for 3-component, --control-border for 4-control. This enables style mode switching via token overrides.

items.title: Control Padding
items.description: Controls don't use padding tokens. Calculate padding from height: calc(var(--control-height) * (1 - var(--ratio))). This maintains consistent proportions. Inputs use half this value for horizontal padding.
